revised_title: Dietetics in Tuberculosis: A Scientific Approach to Nutrition and Recovery
tldr: The authors conducted a seven-year study on the dietetics of tuberculosis, analyzing the metabolism of 200 patients on various diets. They concluded that a 30% increase in protein intake and a slightly concentrated diet are ideal for treating tuberculosis patients, with a standard diet containing 150g of protein, 150g of fat, 250g of carbohydrates, and 3000 calories.
